column4: can someone recommend a commandline bin/cue app to burn a dvd?
dvdauthor is a good one
I haven't tried anything.. have a process going on devede and stuck a dvdr in want to have it burnt when I get home lol
I will look at it now.. thanks
here is some documentation on how to use it http://dvdauthor.sourceforge.net/doc/index.html
you can start the burn from command line or it is for making the bin/cue?
im not sure about bin/cue but it will make a DVD structure
I have the structure.. just don't have access to the computer until after 5.. looking to start the burn through ssh
oh i see what you mean
let me look it up
growisofs -speed=1 -Z /dev/dvd -dvd-video /path/to/your/dvd/structure/files
that with the -dvd-video command will tell the burner to cread a dvd dvid
dvd vid even
its going to be in bin/cue already.  this mean I have to convert It back out?
oh it's in bin/cue already....
yeah..  I checked modim, seems that its support of bin/cue is not great
i would think you would have to mount it then run the previous command
i may be wrong
having never tested this myself i suggest restating your question in chat for further assistance
I think I might have to do something else as well, to get it to an iso so I can use modim... this looks promising  bchunk IMAGE.bin IMAGE.cue IMAGE.iso
never herd of bchunk
thanks for the help.. will give these commands a chance then ask again if it's a failure
good luck, i hope you achieve your goal
